timeline.body:
I believe that the WARNING level is on by default.

Wouldn't it be safer and less likely to spam the log if this were logged at a level that is off by default, like FINE?  Since the failure to delete has not been a reported problem in the past, it seems wise to not risk log spam on systems like Windows.
```suggestion
                    LOGGER.log(WARNING, "Temp file test.test could not be deleted.");
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
I believe that the WARNING level is on by default.

Wouldn't it be safer and less likely to spam the log if this were logged at a level that is off by default, like FINE? Since the failure to delete has not been a reported problem in the past, it seems wise to not risk log spam on systems like Windows.

Suggested change
LOGGER.log(WARNING, "Temp file test.test could not be deleted.");
LOGGER.log(WARNING, "Temp file test.test could not be deleted.");
timeline.author: MarkEWaite

replies.bodyText: Thanks Mark, I changed it as suggested 👍
replies.author: StefanSpieker

timeline.message: set log level to fine, to not provoke futher errors
